list.item: Andrew Foster. V. Consul. Sweden & Norway

div.p: 2. V. Capitol— Cloudy. Fog. Rain Luke 1.

list.item: Pearce. Dutee J— Letters from De Grand & Cranston
Graham— G.— removal of Land-Office— to Tiffin
Pleasonton. S— C. Hammond’s Petn— G. M. Bibb’s Accounts
Clay S.S— Papers. Panama Mission. Canning’s.
Mrs Adams ill— John dined at Govr. Barbour’s. Vaughan’s Ball

list.head: with bills. approved and signed 5. Acts.

list.item: Garnsey— Buffaloe Indians— Took Forward’s Letter.
Hay. G.— of removing power of P.U.S.
Brent— W. L— Act for Chretien

div.p: 5 V. Central Market— Thick fog. [symbols] go to Rockville.

list.item: Met Shackford— Anecdote of his namesake
Connell— John. Visit and dined with us.
O’Brien— Jerh— S. Thacher Collr. Passamaquoddy
Hitchcock.— recommn of J. P. Erving
Webster— D. concerning. C. J. Ingersoll
Mr and Mrs W. S. Smith
Cook. D. P.— for Land Sales in Illinois— S.C. judges
Brent. D— Charges agt. E. Macon— judge [Smith.] Mail robbed.
Williams Lewis— Postmaster Nashville J. P. Irwin
Clay. S.S.— despatches from Rodgers— Everett & T. Brent
Van Ness— son of the Judge
Seymour. H. Collector in Vermont— Fisk. Williams. Hyde
Message to H.R.U.S— N 13. Alaba. Slaves
Barbour. S.W— Creek Treaty to be rejected.
Clay S.S. Consul at Panama. Ratcliff.
Connell John— French and Danish Claims
Ratcliff to be Consul at Panama
Roberdeau— Coln. Institute— Petn. to bring Tyber Water to Capl.
Good— W— to be Justice of Peace, Georgetown
Southard—S.N— Case of C. Smith & Bourne.
Ringgold T— for his Son— Marine Corps—
Blunt. Joseph— New-York Politics— Annual Regr. Distt. Atty.

div.p: [10] IV:50. Capitol— Sun rose 6:14. Behind highest chimney F. Street. met French— Same 4. Octr.

list.item: Lowrie. W. 2. Resns. S.U.S— Michigan Appts. Alabama judge
Leonard. Jacob— For an appointment of Clerk.
Barbour S.W— Creek Treaties— Note from Benton
Mills— E. H— Hull’s Claim— Panama Mission.
Scott. Alexander. Office under the Panama Mission
Rush. S.T. E. Thomson’s Letter [symbols] Nicoll— Excise Comee
Southard S.N— Midn. Van Dyke resigned.
Connell— John— going to-morrow. Lecture. The Administration—
Weightman— Resn. H.R— of Draining Grounds. La Fayette claim
Smith S.— Tilghman for a Cadet. ">Kilgour St. Mary’s.
Ward— A.— Youngs for Light-house keeper
Findlay. James. Burnet for Judge S.C.
Barbour. S.W— Court-Martial Churchill. Cadets. Benton’s Answer.
Clay S.S— Answer to Mareuil— discussed.
Rush S.T. Ay. G’s opinion for Nicoll and C. King. Letter from Ingersoll

div.p: 12. V. Sun rose 6.[16] In line with S.W. corner Treasury— Same 1. Octr.

list.item: Heard Baker— 2. Peter 3.18. Grow in grace.
Taylor. J. W— Of Creek Treaty— Genl. Brown. M’Lean P.M.[G.]

div.p: 13. V:30. To the College 38 [symbols]— Graham’s 16. & to College 22.

list.item: Arell— Richard— with Letter from Mr Monroe. Clerkship— Marine Corps.

list.head: to recommend A. Parris for P.M.G.

list.item: Clay S.S— Hammett’s Letter. Giles— Instrns— Messenger to Anderson.
Commee. to A. Caldwell Judge Western Distt. Virga
Ironside— Took papers of the Panama Mission
Rush again— Josiah Randall here, and C. J. Ingersoll.
Comn. George Wise. Jus Peace, Alexandria.
White. Jos. M— Macon & Jos. L. Smith
Lawrence J. H. of S.C. from St. Augustine— Place.
Brent. D— with Extt. from Everett for Panama message

div.p: 17. IV:30. Capitol. Sun rose 6.4. behind N. edge of S. Chimney Treasury— Same 25. Septr

list.item: M’Lean P.M.G. Postmaster at Nashville J. P. Erwin— Curry
Powell. Charles— Old Soldier and Claimant.
Southard S.N— Rept. to H.R. on D. Porter’s Case
Met and walked with C.J. Marshall— [symbols]
Rush S.T.— to examine papers— interrupted withdrew
Lowrie W— with 2. Resns. of S.U.S. Nominns. confirmed.
Barbour S.W— Took 3. Sentences of Court-martial— Todsen
cashiered. Churchill do. and restored Johnston dismd
Thomas— Jesse B— Favr. of Asbury Dickins— Political movemts.
Seymour. H— Pardon for Cattin—8 yrs. imprisoned
[In]gersoll— C J.— going to-morrow— State of his case—
Ellis— Powhatan going for Mississippi to-morrow.
Mr and Mrs Clay— Mrs L. M’Lane, Dr Huntt and Carter Lee
Biddle— N— Prest. Bank U.S— Evening here.
Heard Hawley— Zechariah 2.8.— Apple of his eye
C L. Bonaparte. Prince of Musignano, and N. Biddle dined with us— W. Lee and Lawrence of N.Y. here

div.p: 20. V. Capitol— Fog— Drizly Sun rose at 6.

list.item: Southard. S.N.— Report on D. Porter’s case.
Rush. S.T.— Returned him S. H. Smith’s Report

list.head: Postmaster at Nashville— J. P. Erwin’s character impeached by Houston— Insolvent. Eavesdropper &c

list.item: Tutt— for Place in general— long narrative & argument

Mercer— Major with Rawle and Speed. visit
Barbour S.W. Report for answer to Call of S.U.S. Creek Treaty papers
Cook. D. P— E. Coles. not recommended for Stockholm

list.head: Postmaster at Nashville— In support of J. P. Erwin’s integrity.

list.item: Gaspar— Mrs. for her husband at Point Comfort
Brent. D.— about [Craig] as Coml Agent at Panama.

Johnson R. M— recommends J. Pope for Stockholm
Exequatur to Figaniere e Morao Consul of His Most Faithful Majesty at N.Y.
M’Lean P.M.G. Letter to me from Eaton & Houston.

list.head: Bissell’s case, discussed—Wirt’s opinion Meeting adjourned to Friday at one

Lowrie. W— S.U.S. Resn. Thompson’s Teas

div.p: 25. V.30. Capitol Met. D. J. Pearce

list.head: Comee. Bills. Appropn. Military Service — Indian Dept.

Harrison. W. H.— going home—three children ill.
Garrison— With recommendation of Jeffers for Charge d’Affaires
[Clar]ke. M. St. C— Resn. H.R.U.S. on Poinsett and pledges.
[Sa]nford. with Letters. Collector at Champlain. Palmer, Sailly &c

list.head: Visitors— Bonfils keeps a boarding School

[Ed]wards, H. W. Surveyor at Middletown in place of T. Savage

Brown— Captn. late of Revenue Cutter— Pay to this time.
Burkhard. from Rio de Janeyro. visits.
His Son— going immediately to La Guayra and Caraccas.
Rush S.T. Letter from Tucker & Duvelle and to Hopkinson.
Clay. S.S. Rept. and Docts. and Resn. H.R.U.S. memorable pledge
Harrison— Has the rhumatism— Recommends Cooley— Sweden
Buchanan— Recommends Markley. for Collector— Phila.
Lowrie— Secy S.— 2. Resns. Appointments C. J. Ingersoll

Barbour S.W. Supplementary Article. Creek Treaty.
Lee. W. About Maltitz and the debate in Senate.
Mercer. C. F. Upon smuggled Negroes and Ohio and Ch: land.

div.p: 31. IV:30. Centre Market. Sun rose 5:47. Same as 13. Septr.
